reviews.review: Un juegazo!! Si no jugaste hl no tuviste infancia corta. Me lo pase en todas las dificultades y las horas que tengo jugando son miles. Una obra maestra de valve por la jugabilidad, lo entretenido que es ya sea modo historia o multijugador, eso si un poco extenso pero eso le da emocion al juego. Los graficos son buenos teniendo en cuenta la epoca en la que fue lanzado. Sin dudas recomiendo hl y aun siendo tan viejo sigue muy vigente online al igual que su hermano el cs 1.6. Por algo quedaron en la historia y siguen estando vigente hasta la actualidad.

For years everyone told me that this was the best game to play ever. After finally completing it for the first time I am disappointed. The movement is awful, the plot is paper thin, combat is laughable, the graphics terrible, and the experience is frustrating. I am sure that for 1998 this game was revolutionary, but for 2018 this game is overhyped and not worth the time.

I'm new to this franchise, so I have no right to judge this game with today's standard. All I can say is that this game is extremely difficult. Mainly due to limited resources, the fact that your hp won't automatically recover. Definitely a great title for those who seek some challenge, not so much for casuals. As a casual gamer myself I really struggle to push forward when in a pinch. Sometimes such situations can be solved by seeking alternative routes/finding hidden rooms while at other times reloading might be required. It's a time consuming game.

Half-Life nasıl desem, artık bir genel kültür öğesine gelmiş bir oyun. Oyuncuların mutlaka oynaması ya da en azından bilmesi gereken bir oyun. Valve'ın en iyi oyunu. Gerçi sadece Valve'ın da değil çıktığı dönemde en iyi oyundu Half-Life. Hikayesi güzel görüntü kalitesi güzel hele hele multiplayer kısmı internet kafelerin vazgeçilmeziydi. Kendi çocukluğumdan hatırlıyorum da bizim internet kafede yer olmazdı sırf herkes oynayabilsin diye herkes en fazla 1 saat aralıksız oturabilirdi. Bir masa boşalınca kimin sırasıysa hemen o masaya geçer oyuna kaldığı yerden devam ederdi. Bomba kurmak, lazer veya süpürge... Bunların anlamları bizim için ayrı bir yer taşır. O dönemde olmayan şimdiki çocuklara üzülüyorum. Asla o internet kafe deneyimini yaşayamıyıcaklar. 

Ama oyun tabiki sadece multiplayer değil. Ne kadar en güzel kısmı o olsada tek kişilik oyuncu moduda gayet eğlenceli. Sessiz dostumuz Gordon Freeman'ın gözünden oynadığımız hikaye modunda yanlış giden bir deney sonrası farklı bir gezegen ile dünya arasında açılan geçitler sayesinde dünyanın uzaylı istalasına uğramasını anlatıyor. Tabi oyundaki tek zorluk uzaylılar değil. Oynanış yeni nesil oyuncuları biraz zorlayabilir. Çünkü yeni oyunların aksine burda şuraya git buraya git diye bir işaretçi yok. Ne yapacağınızı öğrenmek için dostlarınızı iyi dinlemeli ve ne dediklerine önem vermelisiniz aksi halde çoğu oyuncu gibi sağa sola boş boş koşup zaman kaybedersiniz. Ben dahil çoğu kişi dinlemediğimiz için aynı şeyleri yaşadık, aslında biraz da oyunun yapısıyla alakalı geliyor. Öyle bir oyun ki hani oturupta adamları dinleyesiniz gelmiyor yani. 

Neyse işin özü Half-Life bence artık oyun dünyası için genel kültür öğesidir. Oynamasanız bile bilin. Ama ben oynamanızı öneririm.Zaten Valve Complete veya Half-Life Complte alarak tüm seriyi çok uygun bir fiyata edinebilirsiniz. Kaldı ki bu fiyatlar bile indirime giriyor.

The Half-Life series is notorious to me as it is one of my all time favourite franchises, yet I can suddenly hate each of the games at the same time, but that mostly comes from the fact that I haven't grown a spine and need to just get better at them.

 But what about the first game specifically? Well, it sure has stood the test of time, even though it isn't perfect by a long shot. Valve managed to pioneer the FPS genre in a way that wasn't really done elsewhere at the time; instead of trying to ramp up the action as much as possible and make the shooting feel amazing (don't get me wrong the shooting feels fine but is not perfect), they focused on making the story as engaging as possible and pacing the gameplay so that it fits, the world is interconnected, and feels much more alive than other 90s shooters.

In terms of visuals and sound, well, they sure do exist. Okay, in all seriousness, I find the quality of the game to be quite impressive for something from the 90s, not to mention the godsend that is the ability to run in widescreen on moderns systems. While the visuals aren't my favourite things in the world, There are some parts I do enjoy looking at, most of the time they're areas set outside. However in terms of audio, not bad at all. The game's sound effects are pretty good, a lot of the weapons sound punchy and it makes them all feel wonderful. The music fits in very well, although there isn't much of it, it helps add in a bit of flavour to the atmosphere.

 Half-Life has very low lows and very high highs. I feel the game is at its peak in the chapter [i]Surface Tension[/i], it mixes in both story and action without feeling bland, frustrating, nor drawn out. Despite being the longest chapter in the game, it certainly doesn't feel that way, and is my favourite chapter of the entire game.

Now we get to the low points, and I am well aware this has been talked about to death, but the lowest point of the game is obviously Xen. All 4 Xen chapters just don't feel complete and lack any care put into them, I'm going to go into detail on all of them to show my problems with them. 

First of all, [i]Xen[/i]. This is definitely the least interesting chapter of the 4, and a shame, too, it was supposed to be our first look at the end of the game and this big moment that had been hinted at time and time again. All we got, however, was one map that takes like 5 minutes maximum with one boring and unoriginal puzzle and then we move to the next chapter. This brings me onto the next chapter, [i]Gonarch's Lair[/i]. This is probably my favourite out of the 4 as it annoys me the least. The Gonarch boss fight is fine, I mean there's not much to say about it, all you do is repeatedly hit it, it runs off, repeatedly hit it it again, that's the end. The fight itself isn't too bad, however it still is quite underwhelming if you ask me. After that comes [i]Interloper[/i]. I have no idea what they were thinking when they made this. The only good thing about this is that it gives more insight to the relationship between the Vortigaunts and the Xen aliens, still doesn't make it fun though. The chapter is boring, fight segments are frustrating, and it's confusing on where to head to next. And finally, the final boss of the game, [i]Nihilanth[/i]. Not a very good final boss if you ask me. Nihilanth's whole gimmick is that he sends you to other places in Xen, forcing you to go up little areas, while trying to finish off the creature on top of that. The pacing of the fight becomes all wonky, and I don't really feel much after killing it.

This goes to how Valve wanted to [b]make[/b] Xen but didn't know [b]how to make it[/b]. I don't blame them too hard though because the first game in the series was bound to have flaws. Also keep in mind these opinions on Xen were strictly about the levels seen in Half-Life 1 and NOT its fan made remake, Black Mesa.

All in all, the game is definitely worth the praise that it is given, and it's worth a playthrough, as long as you're able to mind the flaws.

Great ride. I knew I had to play this one at some point in my life. This game is very retro and still is very enjoyable. It's kinda amazing how much stuff is happening all the time. I don't see any flaws. Even the very old graphics are still kinda charming. 

Found no bugs or had any crashes. Runs fine on Win 7.

The game can get hard at times but never spikes to nearly impossible. It's challenging but balanced. Lots of weapons, lots scenes, lots of enemies. Plenty to discover. This game is royalty and I happily recommend it.

epic leukemia

The graphics are... charming and the story is fine. The issue is that the combat simply doesn't feel satisfying outside of easy mode, where the enemies turn into bullet sponges and the usually beefy weapons feel weak. The later games were better. Play it, but not on hard mode. Just use console commands to make enemies hit harder (open the console with the ~ key and use the "sk" command. Example: "sk_plr_9mmAR 8" increases the damage the machinegun does).

I didn't appreciate Half-Life enough when I first played it. I knew it was legendary, being the game that basically kickstarted Valve and an entire generation of mods, but I hadn't played many shooters then and it just felt like what I pictured a shooter should be from all I'd heard about them. Looking back on Half-Life now, after playing Half-Life 2, I realize that it's not just some Important Game that was Seminally Influential and it's not just a game for Valve fanboys to fawn over. It's actually a pretty cool game itself, and I think it holds up better than Half-Life 2. It may not be as cinematic, or as visually polished, but it plays smoother, and with a less physics-gimmicky, less expository-pseudo-cutsceney vision. The levels are interesting and the diverse enemy and weapon types make good use of them, forcing you to move and change up your strategy if you want to play the game the fun Action Movie Way. Even ignoring how much I appreciate Valve's legacy that game after this game... I like that.
good

Back in 1998, Valve released Half-Life, it was the most advanced game in terms of graphics and other areas. NPCs can talk to you without cutscenes, enemy AI is intellegent for it's time, graphics blew everybody's minds etc. These factors are what made Half-Life so revolutionary and influencial. The game is over 20 years now and so far, it has aged decently in some areas such as the story, but not in terms of graphics and technical issues (there are many bugs to the game). 

Half-Life may be awesome, but sadly it has to come with a few downsides, because it's an old game, there are many game ruining glitches to it, and sometimes the objectives are not clear and you have to watch a guild to help you.But still, overall Half-Life is one of the greatest games ever made.  I recommend you to play if you love retro games, love the Half-Life series (release Half-Life 3 already Valve!), and sci-fi FPS, then this is the game for you.

Na Half-Life mám spoustu krásnejch vzpomínek. Třeba jak jsme se s mým nejlepším kámošem ze základky snažili sestřelit ten zatracenej vrtulník. Víte kterej, ne? Vylezete ven na skálu a poprvé dostanete raketomet. Tipuju, že to bylo jaro, možná léto 1999. Dva vyjevený kluci u jednoho kompu. Když jeden umřel, druhej ho vystřídal. Z tý hry jsme byli naprosto na větvi. Anglicky jsme samozřejmě rozuměli tak možná SAVE/LOAD, ale to nám bylo jedno. [strike]Byla[/strike] Je to geniálně nadesignovaná hra. Sorry za nostalgii, ale když máme to výročí...
